Package com.ibm.streams.management.job

Interface PeMXBean

public interface PeMXBean
PeMXBean provides attributes, operations, and notifications for managing a processing element (PE) of a Streams job.

Note: The job must be registered before accessing any of these attributes or operations. See InstanceMXBean.registerJob(BigInteger) for more information.

ObjectNameBuilder.pe(String, String, BigInteger) can be used to build the ObjectName for a PeMXBean.

Notifications:
A PeMXBean supports sending the following notifications:

javax.management.AttributeChangeNotification.ATTRIBUTE_CHANGE
Only a subset of the attributes support attribute change notification. A note is included in the attribute description for each attribute that supports attribute change notification

Notifications.PE_CHANGED
Notifications.PE_CONNECTION_ADDED
Notifications.PE_CONNECTION_REMOVED

Notification categories:
These categories can be used with notification filters to easily filter out all notifications in a category.
Notifications.PE_NOTIFICATION

      static final String TYPE
      TYPE is used to identify this bean as a PE bean when building the bean's ObjectName. The value is "domain.instance.pe"

  • Method Details

    • getConnections

      Set<String> getConnections()
      Returns the connection identifiers for connections with either the source or target port contained by this PE. The connection identifier can be used on the ObjectNameBuilder.peConnection(String, String, String) call to get the ObjectName of the managed bean for the operator connection.
      Returns:
      the connection identifiers.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • PeConnectionMXBean

      the domain identifier.

      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.

    • createOperationListener

      ObjectName createOperationListener()
      Creates an OperationListenerMXBean for tracking status messages associated with operations invoked on this bean. Once the operation listener is created, the listener Id can be passed as a parameter on operations which support it. An operation listener can be reused for multiple operation invocations; however, the behavior is undefined if it is used for concurrent operations. All existing messages are cleared at the start of each operation for which the listener is used. The unregister operation should be called on the operation listener after the listener is no longer needed to free the associated memory. All operation listeners are automatically unregistered when the monitored bean is unregistered. An operation listener is also automatically unregistered if it has had no activity for a certain amount of time. The inactivity time is controlled by the JMX_INACTIVITY_TIMEOUT property and is set to 30 minutes by default. If an operation listener bean is needed again, a new one can be created.
      Returns:
      the object name of the created listener bean.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.

    • retrieveApplicationTrace

      String retrieveApplicationTrace(String listenerId)
      Returns an HTTPS URI which can be used to access the application trace messages for the PE.
      Parameters:
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Returns:
      an HTTPS URI to access the trace messages in text/plain format. This URI is valid for a single access for up to two minutes.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • OperationListenerMXBean

    • retrieveConsoleLog

      String retrieveConsoleLog(String listenerId)
      Returns an HTTPS URI which can be used to access the console log messages for the PE.
      Parameters:
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Returns:
      an HTTPS URI to access the console log messages in text/plain format. This URI is valid for a single access for up to two minutes.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • OperationListenerMXBean

    • retrieveMetrics

      Set<Metric> retrieveMetrics(boolean includeAggregates)
      Retrieves the metric information and values for the PE. A metric is a measurement of an element associated with the PE.
      Parameters:
      includeAggregates - specifies whether aggregates of the PE's input and output port metrics should be included in the results. If true, the total tuples processed and total bytes processed for all input ports will be included as well as the total tuples processed and total bytes processed for all output ports.
      Returns:
      the set of metrics for the PE.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • Metric
      • InstanceMXBean.retrieveJobSystemMetricMetadata()

    • retrieveProductLog

      String retrieveProductLog(String listenerId)
      Returns an HTTPS URI which can be used to access the Streams product log messages for the PE. The product log contains service and application messages for use by administrators, instance owners, and application developers.
      Parameters:
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Returns:
      an HTTPS URI to access the product log messages in text/plain format. This URI is valid for a single access for up to two minutes.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • OperationListenerMXBean

    • retrieveProductLogMessages

      String retrieveProductLogMessages(String filters, String listenerId)
      Returns an HTTPS URI to retrieve a filtered set of messages for the PE from the Streams product log. If there are multiple rolling product logs, the contents of all are filtered from oldest to newest. The product log contains service and application messages for use by administrators, instance owners, and application developers.
      Parameters:
      filters - identifies the set of filters to apply to the product log messages. Only messages matching all filters are returned. The format of the filters value is a serialized string of a JSON object. Possible properties included in the object are:
      • LoggingPropertiesMXBean.FILTER_CONTENT A regular expression string or an array of regular expression strings. Only messages containing content matching the specified regular expressions are returned.
      • LoggingPropertiesMXBean.FILTER_LEVEL A string or an array of strings. Each value specifies a message log level. The value must be the value returned by LoggingPropertiesMXBean.Level.toString(). Only messages with the specified logging levels are returned.
      • LoggingPropertiesMXBean.FILTER_COUNT An integer specifying the maximum number of messages to return.
      • LoggingPropertiesMXBean.FILTER_START_TIME A long specifying a start time as the number of milliseconds since the epoch. Only messages with a timestamp after this time are returned.
      • LoggingPropertiesMXBean.FILTER_END_TIME A long specifying an end time as the number of milliseconds since the epoch. Only messages with a timestamp before or equal to this time are returned.
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Returns:
      an HTTPS URI to access the filtered product log messages in text/plain format. This URI is valid for a single access for up to two minutes.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if filters is not in the correct format or an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • snapshot

      String snapshot(int maximumDepth, boolean includeStaticAttributes)
      Takes a current snapshot of the PE attributes and returns an HTTPS URI to retrieve the results. Attributes of descendant objects and static attributes can optionally be included.
      Parameters:
      maximumDepth - specifies which descendant object attributes should be included in the snapshot. Values are handled as follows:
      • less than zero - all descendant attributes are included.
      • zero - no descendant attributes are included.
      • one - only attributes for immediate child objects are included. Immediate children include: operators, PE input ports, and PE output ports.
      • greater than one - attributes for descendants are included up to the level specified.
      includeStaticAttributes - indicates whether static attributes should be included in the snapshot. A static attribute is a attribute that does not change and that is not an identifier attribute. A note is included in the attribute description for each attribute that is not included in the snapshot if includeStaticAttributes is false.
      Returns:
      an HTTPS URI to access the attribute values in application/json format. This URI is valid for a single access for up to two minutes.

      The attribute values are provided in JSON format. This format is described in the product documentation. See topic: REST management API reference > Get PE. The following differences exist for the JMX output:

      • The REST specific properties: resourceType, restid, and self are not included.
      • The connections, metrics, host, currentWorkingPath, and restartPriority properties are not included.
      • The values of the domain, instance, and job properties are the unique identifiers for each.
      • A resource property is included. The value is the unique identifier for the resource on which the PE is running.
      • The inputPorts, operators, and outputPorts properties are only included if maximumDepth is non-zero. The value for each of these properties is an embedded array containing snapshot objects for each immediate child of the PE. For the format of these objects, see: OperatorMXBean, PeInputPortMXBean, PeOutputPortMXBean.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • snapshotMetrics

      String snapshotMetrics()
      Takes a current snapshot of the PE's metrics and returns an HTTPS URI to retrieve the results.
      Returns:
      an HTTPS URI to access the metric values in application/json format. This URI is valid for a single access for up to two minutes.

      The metric values are provided in JSON format. This format is the same as the PE array element format documented in JobMXBean.snapshotMetrics().

      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • start

      void start(String resourceId, String listenerId)
      Starts the PE on the specified resource. If the PE is already started and IllegalStateException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      resourceId - specifies the Streams unique identifier for the resource on which to start the PE. If the value is null, a resource will be selected from the instance resource list. Null is the recommended value for most users.
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • OperationListenerMXBean
      • ResourceMXBean

    • stop

      void stop(String listenerId)
      Stops the PE.
      Parameters:
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
